I love that all of the Monster High blu rays also come with the DVD and digital versions - it's such a great value for the money you pay (which often isn't that much more than the DVD by itself!)  Haunted was the first MH movie that I watched on Netflix and got me interested in these dolls more seriously.  Each movie focuses on one of the ghouls primarily, though there are often subplots for other main characters: this one goes off the 6 main ghouls and focuses on Spectra Vondergeist, a ghost student who transferred from Haunted High and runs a gossip blog.  When she learns that Draculaura is being haunted, she returns to her old school to find out who is crossing over from the ghost world and why.  Ghosts and other monsters have been kept mostly separate for a few hundred years since the days of the Red Lady, a ghost who terrorized "normies" and other monsters.  As she is investigating, she meets a new manster, Porter Geist, and gets trapped in her old school by "detention chains," a system of punishment being handed out by the mysterious Principle Revenant.

There are some great dolls that are tied in to this movie, including 4 new characters (Porter Geist, Vandala Doubloons, River Styxx, and Kiomy Haunterly), a new outfit for Spectra, and ghost versions of Clawdeen, Draculaura, Twyla, and a very hard to find Rochelle Goyle (I think she may have been a store exclusive somewhere, but I'm not 100% sure).

If you pick this movie up, I definitely recommend getting this 3-version combo pack as it will definitely be your best value for the money!  These movies are fun for kids, and there are always little humorous moments that are included for adults as well that make these entertaining and worth watching.
